text.string: Strength measures your muscle, physical power and stamina. This attribute is especially important for melee and unarmed combat where it has a direct impact on the damage output. It also influences the maximum weight you can carry and the encumbrance when wearing Armor. Somebody with high Strength receives less encumbrance penalty when wearing Heavy Armor.
Constitution represents your health. This value adds to your hit points and influences the effect of disease. This attribute is useful for any profession but especially for combat classes.

Agility affects your movement and balance ability. A character with high agility can move more swiftly and is physically more flexible than others. This attribute is especially important for stealth and combat classes. High agility also has a positive effect on Armor encumbrance.

Precision governs how good you can handle tasks and devices that require a precise eye and a good hand-eye coordination. This attribute is especially important for ranged combat but also useful for Medics, Pilots and technical classes. Precision also affects Critical Hit Chance and Strikethrough Value.

Intelligence represents one's ability to analyze information and determines how well you learn and reason. Intelligence is important for Scouts and for technical and medical classes. For Psychics intelligence governs the power of their psychic abilities. Intelligence also adds a bonus for learning new skills faster.

Wisdom describes a character's common sense, perception and intuition. Compared to Intelligence, Wisdom is more related to being in tune with and aware of one's surroundings. High Wisdom means keen senses and is important for Scouts, Spies and Psychics. Wisdom also governs the mental resistance against fear, pain and insanity.

Charisma measures your force of personality, persuasiveness, ability to lead and physical attractiveness. It represents actual strength of personality and force of presence. Charisma is especially useful for dialogue where it governs Diplomacy, Bluff and Intimidation. It also affects haggling prices when trading and is important for Squad Leaders to convince the team members.
This attribute measures your luck. Luck might influence anything but has no effect on skills. Luck also affects Critical Hit Chance and Gambling.
Increases the aggro that a mob in combat has towards you. This ability is useful to get mobs to attack you instead of other party members.
This ability allows you to recover immediately from being knocked down if you have enough ability points.
This ability will cause your character to focus on avoiding combat blows. This will only apply when you are wielding a melee weapon.
This ability allows you to give up an attack round in order to gain better accuracy on your next ranged attack.
This ranged attack is designed to confuse its target, and can stun and dizzy its target as well.
This ranged attack to an opponents torso has a chance of hitting vital areas causing additional bleeding damage.
This medical enhancement ability allows the temporary enhancement of the Action pool.
This skill improves your defense against melee and unarmed attacks.
This skill will improve your speed with all melee weapons or unarmed.
This skill will improve your accuracy with all melee weapons and while unarmed.
This skill improves your damage when fighting with a melee weapon or unarmed.

The basic melee profession, proficient in hand to hand combat and with a number of simple weapons. Other melee professions, that is skills dealing with close ranged weapons, spawn from these disciplines.
The Novice Brawler possesses a slightly better than rudimentary knowledge of the use of melee weapons.
Trains the Brawler in simple unarmed combat techniques.
